content:
**"Policyholder, Insured, You or Your"** refers to the person named in the Certificate of Insurance and under whose name this Policy has been issued.

**"Schedule"** refers to the document which reflects details of yourself, the Insured vehicle, any Authorised Driver and/or any terms and conditions that are specific to Your contract.

**"We, Our, Us or the Company"** refers to HL Assurance Pte. Ltd.

**"Windscreen"** refers to front, side, rear back and quarter glass of the Insured Vehicle.

**"Young and/or Inexperienced Driver"** refers to any person who at the time of loss or damage to the Insured Vehicle is below twenty-seven (27) years of age and/or has held a valid driving license for less than two (2) years.

### SECTION I - INSURANCE ON THE INSURED VEHICLE
questions: What does 'Policyholder, Insured, You or Your' mean in the insurance document?
What information is included in the 'Schedule' of the insurance policy?
Who is referred to by 'We, Our, Us or the Company' in the insurance policy?
What parts of the vehicle does the term 'Windscreen' cover in the insurance policy?
Who qualifies as a 'Young and/or Inexperienced Driver' under the insurance policy?
What is the age limit for someone to be considered a young driver in this insurance policy?
How long must a driver have held a license to be considered inexperienced according to this policy?
What company is issuing the insurance policy described in the text?
What document should I refer to for specific terms and conditions of my insurance contract?
What does SECTION I generally cover in this insurance policy?
